item.text: So the Lord said to Moses, “See, I have made you like God to Pharaoh, and your brother Aaron will be your prophet.

<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> are to <st data-num="01696" class="">speak</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">command</st> you,<n id="2" /> and your <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> is to <st data-num="01696" class="">tell</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> that he must <st data-num="07971" class="">release</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st> from his <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.

But <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="07185" class="">harden</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh’s</st> <st data-num="03820" class="">heart</st>, and although I will <st data-num="07235" class="">multiply</st><n id="2" /> my <st data-num="0226" class="">signs</st> and my <st data-num="04159" class="">wonders</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>,

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you.<n id="1" /> I will <st data-num="05414 03027" class="">reach</st> into<n id="2" /> <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> and <st data-num="03318">bring out</st> my <st data-num="06635" class="">regiments</st>,<n id="3" /> my <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478" class="">Israelites</st>, from the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> with <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="08201" class="">acts of judgment</st>.
Then the Egyptians will know that I am the Lord when I extend my hand over Egypt and bring the Israelites out from among them.”
And Moses and Aaron did so; they did just as the Lord commanded them.
Now Moses was eighty years old and Aaron was eighty-three years old when they spoke to Pharaoh.
The Lord said to Moses and Aaron,

“<st data-num="03588" class="">When</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">says</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you, ‘<st data-num="05414" class="">Do</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="04159" class="">miracle</st>,’ and you <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st>, ‘<st data-num="03947" class="">Take</st> your <st data-num="04294" class="">staff</st> and <st data-num="07993" class="">throw</st> it <st data-num="07993">down</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st>,’ it will <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st><n id="3" /> a <st data-num="08577" class="">snake</st>.”
When Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh, they did so, just as the Lord had commanded them—Aaron threw down his staff before Pharaoh and his servants, and it became a snake.

Then <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">summoned</st> <st data-num="02450" class="">wise men</st> and <st data-num="03784" class="">sorcerers</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="02748" class="">magicians</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> by their <st data-num="03858" class="">secret arts</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st> the <st data-num="03651" class="">same thing</st>.

<st data-num="0376" class="">Each man</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07993" class="">threw down</st> his <st data-num="04294" class="">staff</st>, and the staffs <st data-num="01961" class="">became</st> <st data-num="08577" class="">snakes</st>. But <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron’s</st> <st data-num="04294" class="">staff</st> <st data-num="01104" class="">swallowed up</st> their <st data-num="04294" class="">staffs</st>.
Yet Pharaoh’s heart became hard, and he did not listen to them, just as the Lord had predicted.
The Lord said to Moses, “Pharaoh’s heart is hard; he refuses to release the people.

<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> in the <st data-num="01242" class="">morning</st> <st data-num="02009" class="">when</st><n id="1" /> he <st data-num="03318" class="">goes out</st> to the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>. <st data-num="05324" class="">Position</st> yourself<n id="2" /> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> him <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="08193" class="">edge</st> of the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st>,<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st><n id="4" /> in your <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> the <st data-num="04294" class="">staff</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> was <st data-num="02015" class="">turned</st> into a <st data-num="05175" class="">snake</st>.
Tell him, ‘The Lord, the God of the Hebrews, has sent me to you to say, “Release my people, that they may serve me in the wilderness!” But until now you have not listened.
This is what the Lord has said: “By this you will know that I am the Lord: I am going to strike the water of the Nile with the staff that is in my hand, and it will be turned into blood.

<st data-num="01710" class="">Fish</st><n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st> will <st data-num="04191" class="">die</st>, the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st> will <st data-num="0887" class="">stink</st>, and the <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptians</st> will be <st data-num="03811" class="">unable</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02975">Nile</st>.”’”

Then the Lord said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Take your staff and stretch out your hand over Egypt’s waters—over their rivers, over their canals, over their ponds, and over all their reservoirs—so that it becomes blood.’ There will be blood everywhere in the land of Egypt, even in wooden and stone containers.”

Moses and Aaron did so, just as the Lord had commanded. He raised the staff and struck the water that was in the Nile right before the eyes of Pharaoh and his servants, and all the water that was in the Nile was turned to blood.

When the <st data-num="01710" class="">fish</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> were in the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>, the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st> began<n id="2" /> to <st data-num="0887" class="">stink</st>, so that the <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptians</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">could</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st>. There <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">everywhere</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>!
But the magicians of Egypt did the same by their secret arts, and so Pharaoh’s heart remained hard, and he refused to listen to Moses and Aaron—just as the Lord had predicted.

And <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="06437" class="">turned</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">into</st> his <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>. He did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07896" class="">pay</st> any <st data-num="03820" class="">attention</st> to <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st>.<n id="1" />
All the Egyptians dug around the Nile for water to drink, because they could not drink the water of the Nile.
Seven full days passed after the Lord struck the Nile.
